Very interesting stuff,
	Thanks Barry for posting this. Ballast sold as souvenirs is an  
intriguing thought, but I like the idea of "western bullets from the  
siege of Osaka"used as talisman in a Tokugawa sword! from De Liefde  
no less!
great stuff,
-t

On Feb 19, 2007, at 6:42 PM, Barry Thomas wrote:

> All,
>
> I've just discovered this little gem about the history of Namban  
> tetsu (foreign steel) in Japanese history and the involvement of  
> the Dutch V.O.C. Company. Namban tetsu was used in the making of  
> swords and so recorded on the sword tang.
>
> http://tokensugita.com/NT.htm
>
> Regards,
>
> Barry Thomas.
